long-term memory is the ability to store and retrieve information over long periods of time.

inhibitory control is the ability to inhibit or suppress inappropriate or irrelevant responses.

The interest rate on an ARM can change every month, every year, or at some other interval, depending on the terms of the mortgage.

A fixed rate mortgage, on the other hand, is a mortgage in which the interest rate is fixed for the life of the loan. This means that the borrower's monthly payments will remain the same for the entire term of the loan, regardless of changes in market interest rates.

The main difference between an ARM and a fixed rate mortgage is the level of predictability and stability in monthly payments.
